official-title.#text: To provide for research with respect to Lyme disease and other tick-borne diseases, and for other purposes.

attestation-date.#text: Passed the House of Representatives September 9, 2014.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Tick-Borne Disease Research Accountability and Transparency Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Tick-Borne Disease Research Accountability and Transparency Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following new part:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Title III of the Public Health Service Act

header.#text: Lyme disease and other tick-borne diseases

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall conduct or support epidemiological, basic, translational, and clinical research regarding Lyme disease and other tick-borne diseases.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall ensure that each biennial report under
includes information on actions undertaken by the
with respect to Lyme disease and other tick-borne diseases, including an assessment of the progress made in improving the outcomes of Lyme disease and such other tick-borne diseases.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall establish a permanent working group, to be known as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Interagency Lyme and Tick-Borne Disease Working Group
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Interagency Lyme and Tick-Borne Disease Working Group

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: concerning Lyme disease and other tick-borne diseases to ensure interagency coordination, minimize overlap, and examine research priorities.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Department of Health and Human Services

quote.#tail: ), to review all efforts within the

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Interagency Lyme and Tick-Borne Disease Working Group

text.#text: The
not later than 24 months after the date of enactment of this part, and every 24 months thereafter, develop or update a summary of—

ongoing Lyme disease and other tick-borne disease research related to causes, prevention, treatment, surveillance, diagnosis, diagnostics, duration of illness, intervention, and access to services and supports for individuals with Lyme disease or other tick-borne diseases;
advances made pursuant to such research;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: with persons that participate at the public meetings required by
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Department of Health and Human Services

text.#text: the engagement of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: at such public meetings and the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Interagency Lyme and Tick-Borne Disease Working Group

text.#text: the comments received by the
ensure that a broad spectrum of scientific viewpoints is represented in each such summary;
monitor Federal activities with respect to Lyme disease and other tick-borne diseases;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: regarding any appropriate changes to such activities; and

text.#text: make recommendations to the
ensure public input by holding annual public meetings that address scientific advances, research questions, surveillance activities, and emerging strains in species of pathogenic organisms.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall be composed of a total of 14 members as follows:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Interagency Lyme and Tick-Borne Disease Working Group

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Office of the Assistant Secretary for Health

the

text.#text: the
the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Department of Health and Human Services

text.#text: such other agencies and offices of the
Seven Federal members, consisting of one or more representatives of each of—
Physicians and other medical providers with experience in diagnosing and treating Lyme disease and other tick-borne diseases.
Scientists or researchers with expertise.
Patients and their family members.
Nonprofit organizations that advocate for patients with respect to Lyme disease and other tick-borne diseases.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: to be beneficial to the functioning of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Interagency Lyme and Tick-Borne Disease Working Group

text.#text: Other individuals whose expertise is determined by the
Seven non-Federal public members, consisting of representatives of the following categories:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Interagency Lyme and Tick-Borne Disease Working Group

text.#text: In making appointments under

text.#text: The non-Federal public members of the

Committee on Health, Education, Labor and Pensions of the Senate

text.#text: shall submit a report on its activities, including an up-to-date summary under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Department of Health and Human Services

text.#text: shall make each such report publicly available on the website of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Interagency Lyme and Tick-Borne Disease Working Group

text.#text: shall allow any member of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: a strategic plan, informed by the most recent summary under
, for the conduct and support of Lyme disease and tick-borne disease research, including—

text.#text: Not later than 3 years after the date of enactment of this section, and every 5 years thereafter, the
proposed budgetary requirements;
a plan for improving outcomes of Lyme disease and other tick-borne diseases, including progress related to chronic or persistent symptoms and chronic or persistent infection and co-infections;
a plan for improving diagnosis, treatment, and prevention;
appropriate benchmarks to measure progress on achieving the improvements described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and other relevant information developed by the
to the public, including health care providers, public health departments, and other relevant medical groups.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Interagency Lyme and Tick-Borne Disease Working Group

text.#text: a plan to disseminate each summary under

header.#text: Lyme disease and other tick-borne diseases

text.#text: No additional funds are authorized to be appropriated to carry out this Act and the amendment made by this Act, and this Act and such amendment shall be carried out using amounts otherwise available for such purpose.
